operations.description: Validates that the input content is compliant with a given schema. This operation supports referencing many schemas (using comma as a separator) which include each other.

parameters.description: The path to the schema file. You can specify multiple schema locations by using a comma separator
parameters.name: schemas

parameters.description: The schema language to use.
parameters.name: schemaLanguage

parameters.description: the XML content to validate
parameters.name: content

displayModel.summary: Set to NEVER to prevent XXE and DoS attacks

parameters.description: The name of the configuration to be used to execute this component
parameters.name: config-ref

operations.name: validateSchema

operations.description:
Evaluates an XPath expression the input content and returns the result.

Because XPath expressions can match any number of individual elements, this operation returns a List of Strings. If no element matched the expression, an empty list will be returned.

XPath expressions are also namespace aware, which is why this operation allows setting namespace mappings. These mappings will be merged with those optionally defined in the referenced namespace-directory, meaning that the evaluation will combine both sets of namespace mappings.

parameters.description: the XML content on which the XPath is evaluated
parameters.name: content

parameters.description: the XPath script
parameters.name: xpath

parameters.description: Properties that wil be made available to the transform context.
parameters.name: contextProperties

parameters.description: namespace mappings that will be used in this evaluation. They will be combined with the ones in the config element
parameters.name: namespaces

parameters.description: the namespace directory from which take base namespace mappings
parameters.name: namespaceDirectory

parameters.description: adds a newline character (\n) at the end of every xml-part result
parameters.name: addTrailingNewlines

displayModel.summary: Set to NEVER to prevent XXE and DoS attacks

parameters.description: The mime type of the payload that this operation outputs.
parameters.name: outputMimeType

parameters.description: The name of the configuration to be used to execute this component
parameters.name: config-ref

parameters.description: The name of a variable on which the operation's output will be placed
parameters.name: target

parameters.description: An expression that will be evaluated against the operation's output and the outcome of that expression will be stored in the target variable
parameters.name: targetValue

operations.name: xpathExtract

parameters.description: Allows to globally map prefixes to namespace uris. On this version, the xpath-extract operation is the only one to consume these mappings
parameters.name: namespaces

displayModel.summary: Set to NEVER to prevent XXE and DoS attacks

parameters.description: Defines how to treat entity expansion. Setting a value different than NEVER renders the application vulnerable to XXE and/or DoS attacks
parameters.name: expandEntities

parameters.description: The identifier of this element used to reference it in other components
parameters.name: name

parameters.description: Configures the minimum amount of time that a dynamic configuration instance can remain idle before the runtime considers it eligible for expiration. This does not mean that the platform will expire the instance at the exact moment that it becomes eligible. The runtime will actually purge the instances when it sees it fit.

description.value: Configures the minimum amount of time that a dynamic configuration instance can remain idle before the runtime considers it eligible for expiration. This does not mean that the platform will expire the instance at the exact moment that it becomes eligible. The runtime will actually purge the instances when it sees it fit.
A scalar time value for the maximum amount of time a dynamic configuration instance should be allowed to be idle before it's considered eligible for expiration
A time unit that qualifies the maxIdleTime attribute

parameters.name: expirationPolicy

extensionModel.description: A Mule Module which provides functionality to handle XML. This module should be used for advanced use cases or use cases associated with XML standards such as XSLT, XPath and XQuery or XSD. Take in mind that DataWeave is not only perfectly capable to handle most of those use cases and can replace those standards the majority of the times, but it's also our recommended approach.
extensionModel.name: XML
